required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metric Properties of de Morton Mobility Index
clinical_study.official_title: Metric Properties of de Morton Mobility Index in Rehabilitation Patients With Musculoskeletal Impairments

lead_sponsor.agency: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

clinical_study.source: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

brief_summary.textblock: Metric properties (convergent validity, predict validity, known-groups validity, responsiveness, floor and ceiling effects, minimal clinically important difference) of the de Morton Mobility Index (DEMMI) in patients with musculoskeletal impairments undergoing impatient rehabilitation will be investigated.

detailed_description.textblock: Convergent validity of DEMMI will be assessed in terms of correlations with the other outcome measures. Known-groups validity will be demonstrated by differences in DEMMI scores between patients who were not able to walk and those who were able to walk with or without walking aid. Predictive validity of DEMMI at admission for functional independence at discharge from rehabilitation will be estimated. The minimal clinically important difference of DEMMI, responsiveness and floor or ceiling effects will also be estimated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 30 days (difference between admission and discharge)
primary_outcome.description: DEMMI is a unidimensional 15-item measure of mobility for adults

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 30 days (difference between admission and discharge)
secondary_outcome.description: 10mWT assesses comfortable walking speed over the distance of 10 meters

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 30 days (difference between admission and discharge)
secondary_outcome.description: 6mWT assesses assess aerobic capacity and endurance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 30 days (difference between admission and discharge)
secondary_outcome.description: FIM is an 18-item two-dimensional instrument that explores physical and psychosocial functioning

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 30 days (difference between admission and discharge)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D-3L is a patient-reported instrument for measuring HRQOL

study_pop.textblock: Patients with musculoskeletal impairments with or without impairments of peripheral nerves

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- admission to inpatient rehabilitation
- written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- associated impairments of the central nervous system or other severe health conditions

overall_official.affiliation: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia

facility.name: University Rehabilitation Institute, Republic of Slovenia
